Abstract: This paper explores the evolving landscape of construction robotics, examining the transition from automation to collaboration in architectural practices. We investigate the integration of advanced sensing technologies and industrial robots in construction processes, highlighting their potential to enhance efficiency and precision. The study focuses on the emerging paradigm of humanâ€“robot collaboration, analyzing its impact on traditional construction methodologies and workforce dynamics. By reviewing recent advancements in robotics and their applications in architecture, we identify key challenges and opportunities in implementing collaborative robotic systems on construction sites. Our findings suggest that the future of construction lies in the synergy between human expertise and robotic capabilities, paving the way for more innovative and sustainable building practices.
